intro: Alyssum psilocarpum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the white-flowered psilocarpum, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with hairy stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain seeds. This variant is distinguished by its pale-colored flowers and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
